greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of Dyck paths of semilength n having k ascents of length 2 starting at an even level (0<=k<=floor(n/2)).
comment: Row n has 1+floor(n/2) terms. Row sums are the Catalan numbers (A000108). Sum(kT(n,k), k=0..floor(n/2)) = binomial(2n-3,n-1)-binomial(2n-4,n) = A077587(n-2) (n>=2). Column 0 yields A114464.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
example: T(4,1) = 7 because we have (UU)DDUDUD, UD(UU)DDUD, UDUD(UU)DD, (UU)DUDDUD,

UD(UU)DUDD, (UU)DUDUDD and (UU)DUUDDD, where U=(1,1), D=(1,-1) (the ascents of length 2 starting at an even level are shown between parentheses; note that the last path has an ascent of length 2 that starts at an odd level).
maple: G:= 1/2/z*(3*z^2+2*z^3*t+1-z^3*t^2-3*z^2*t-z^3+t*z-z -sqrt(1+20*z^3*t-18*z^5*t^2+15*z^4*t^2+18*z^5*t+6*z^5*t^3-2*z^4*t^3-12*z^2*t -12*z^3 -6*z-24*z^4*t-8*z^3*t^2+z^6-6*z^5+11*z^4 +z^2*t^2+6*z^6*t^2 -4*z^6*t^3 -4*z^6*t+z^6*t^4+2*t*z +11*z^2)): Gser:=simplify(series(G,z=0,17)): P[0]:=1: for n from 1 to 14 do P[n]:=coeff(Gser,z^n) od: for n from 0 to 14 do seq(coeff(t*P[n],t^j),j=1..1+floor(n/2)) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
b:= proc(x, y, t) option remember; `if`(y<0 or y>x, 0, `if`(x=0,
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, z, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(2*n, 0$2)):
mathematica: b[x_, y_, t_] := b[x, y, t] = If[y<0 || y>x, 0, If[x==0, If[t==2, z, 1], Expand[ b[x-1, y-1, Min[3, t+1]] + If[t==2 && Mod[y, 2]==0, z, 1]*b[x-1, y+1, 0]]]]; T[n_] := Function[{p}, Table[Coefficient[p, z, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, z]}]][b[2*n, 0, 0]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 31 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Nov 29 2005
